data.title: Multiple decorations on end of line

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I would like to be able to add multiple editor decorations on the end of line. 

My use case is nicely decorating inline values to make a difference between a name and a value. A nice example on how chrome does this:

An alternative would be a mechanism that I could somehow specially annotate parts of the contentText, however since we use css::after this might be impossible.

data.title: Git (SCM) issues in latest insiders
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: `1.9.0-insider` f67f87c5498d9361c0b29781c341fd032815314b
- OS Version: macOS Sierra `10.12.2`

The new SCM changes seem to have lost a bunch of functionality as well as caused some bugs.

Bugs:
- The SCM icon (hopefully it is temporary) doesn't show any badge (count) until you open it.
- Can't open a file diff (from the SCM pane) with [GitLens](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=eamodio.gitlens) installed -- throws errors. I will take a look into this, but I mention it mainly because it could break a bunch of users until I get an update out. -- EDIT: I've pushed a new version of GitLens that fixes the issue (I was using a DocumentScheme of `git` it is now `gitlens-git`)

Missing features:
- Commit button is missing
- Many missing Git commands from the content menu (pull, push, etc)
- File diff is missing toggle back (and forth) to the file
- Staging lines -- was an AWESOME feature (would have been nice to even be more prominent)
- Commit message length notification

data.title: Merge conflicts not highlighted in editor
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0-insider f67f87c5498d9361c0b29781c341fd032815314b
- OS Version: MacOS Sierra

With today's update the merge conflicts are not highlighted anymore. Before, they were marked with a strong background color.

These guys here:
```js
<<<<<<< HEAD // not marked, only recognized as syntax error
     // something
=======  // not marked, only recognized as syntax error
      // something else
>>>>>>> My Commit  // not marked, only recognized as syntax error
```
Steps to Reproduce:

1. create a merge conflict (via rebasing or something else)
2. open file containing conflicts

data.title: ITerminalInstance.reuseTerminal only works if terminal is still running
data.body: I would like to reuse a terminal instance where the shell / executable has already finished. To make this happen I would like to pass an argument to the createInstance via the IShellLaunchConfig that allows the following values. The new property would replace the current waitOnExit. It could be named 'onExit' and accept the following enum values: `wait`: would be the same as waitOnExit: true, `close`: would be the same as waitOnExit: false, `keep`: would keep the terminal instance alive. If reuseTerminal is call a new shell / pty process is start if non is running.

data.title: Ensure 'configurationEditingService.doWriteConfiguration' flushes to disk before a window reload.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.81 ~ 1.9.0 (insiders)
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Call `vscode.workspace.getConfiguration().update('someSetting', value);` to update a configuration value on disk.
2. Call `vscode.workspace.getConfiguration().update('someOtherSetting', value);` to update another configuration value on disk.
3. Immediately call `vscode.commands.executeCommand('workbench.action.reloadWindow');` to trigger window reload.
4. Notice only first setting gets updated.

The reason seems to be that the app doesn't wait for the `queue` to get flushed before reloading.

My current workaround is to introduce a delay before reloading in order for the updates to get persisted on disk.

data.title: Focus issues with Home/End in Autocomplete dialog

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:

Version 1.9.0-insider
Commit 2cdc2b3da8f0fd5322b48747241584cf9dd98f8f
Date 2017-01-13T07:03:18.620Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0

- OS Version:

Ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type something that triggers auto complete
2. Press up & down arrow. Press pagup & pagedown. In both cases, focus moves within the auto suggestions dialog
3. Now press home/end, the auto complete dialog closes & the cursor moves to the start of the line. Instead the first/last item in the auto suggest needs to be selected in the dialog without closing the auto suggest window.

#### Why should the implementation for Home/End buttons needs to be changed?

1. Because the user was interested in narrowing down the auto suggest results by pressing `up`/`down`/`pgup`/`pgdn`/the key combination that triggers auto suggestions `ctrl+space`. So we should assume that he would be interested in moving within the autosuggest dialog when he presses either `home`/`end` after he presses any of the key combinations mentioned above

2. IntelliJ implementation is along similar lines

#### Suggestion on the implementation of handling Home/End.

1. If the user starts typing & auto suggest window automatically opens up, `home`/`end` will take the user to start/end of the line in the editor after closing the dialog (the current behaviour)
2. If the `home`/`end` buttons are pressed after user presses `up`/`down`/`pgup`/`pgdn`/`ctrl+space` keys, the subsequent `home`/`end` buttons should move the focus within the dialog, not in the editor

data.title: Select All Occurrences ("selectHighlights") is case insensitive
data.body:
Selecting all code occurrences via the keyboard binding

`"command": "editor.action.selectHighlights"`

does not maintain case integrity of the selection.  Further, there is no way to toggle case-sensitive options for this action, rendering it unsafe and impractical.

data.title: jump to another file doesn't work
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:1.8.1
- OS Version:macOS 10.12.2

Steps to Reproduce:

```
// file a.js
const M = module.exports = {};
M.A = '';

//file b.js
const M = require('./a');
const A = M.A;

```
and now press `command` and click `A` of `M.A` in b.js, it can noe jump to `M.A` where in `a.js`

data.title: Add action(and ultimately a shortcut) to narrow auto suggestions by suggestion type
data.body:
Currently vscode does no have a way to filter the auto suggestions to include just to templates (and toggle back to all suggestions by pressing the same shortcut). User needs to navigate a lot of suggestions (not just templates) is he does not clearly remember template trigger words.

Intellij have this concept of `insert live template` that just filters/shows suggestions to templates instead of all symbols. This will help the developer to search in templates instead of navigating all suggestions before finding the actual one he is interested in.

For eg., in Intellij, type few characters(it shows the default auto suggestions) & press `Ctrl+J`(Insert a live template) will narrow the suggestions just to templates instead of all options.
